overview:
Jess Kimball, the New York head of Takeout, got her start as the speechwriter for futurist and New York Times “Nostradamus of marketing” Faith Popcorn. In three years’ time Jess predicted the future for audiences all over the world, including Singapore, Monaco, and London. The highlight of Jess’s speechwriting career was co-penning Faith’s address on sustainability for the 2006 Global Brand Forum in Monaco, where Faith headlined with Al Gore. Press deemed the speech “an awe-inspiring take on the future.”

Applying her futurist skills towards changing marketing communications, Jess moved on as an early employee of famed London agency Naked’s New York office. Serving as Strategy Director, Jess co-developed cutting edge products and worked with clients spanning three continents, including Samsung, Kraft, Unilever, and Kimberly-Clark.
